string-array.name: earthquake
string-array.item: Keep a disaster kit ready with important documents, torch, radio and medicines in approachable distance at your house If you feel small shaking evacuate building.
Duck, Cover, Hold and slowly move to safer place.
If you are outdoors, find a clear spot away from buildings, trees, streetlights, and power lines.
Drop to the ground .
If driving – pull over to clear location and be in the vehicle
If you are in a coastal area, move to higher ground.
Tsunamis are often created by earthquakes.

string-array.name: earthquaked
string-array.item: Don’t run – try to drop to the ground.

string-array.name: cyclone
string-array.item: Listen to the radio (All India Radio stations give weather warnings.
Keep monitoring the warnings. This will help you to prepare for a cyclone emergency.
Pass on the information to others.
Believe in the official information When a cyclone alert is on for your area continue normal working but stay alert to the radio warnings.
Remember that a cyclone alert means that the danger is within 24 hours. Stay alert.
When your area is under cyclone warning get away from low-lying beaches or other low-lying areas \n\t close to the coast Leave early before your way to high ground or shelter gets flooded.
If your house is securely built on high ground take shelter in the safer part of the house However, if asked to evacuate do not hesitate to leave the place.
Board up glass windows or put storm shutters in place.
Provide strong suitable support for outside doors.
If you do not have wooden boards handy, paste paper strips on glasses to prevent splinters.
However, this may not avoid breaking windows.
Get extra food, which can be eaten without cooking. Store extra drinking water in suitably covered vessels.
If you are to evacuate the house move your valuable articles to upper floors to minimize flood damage.
Have hurricane lantern, torches or other emergency lights in working conditions and keep them handy.
Small and loose things, which can fly in strong winds, should be stored safely in a room.
Be sure that a window and door can be opened only on the side opposite to the one facing the wind.
Make provision for children and adults requiring special diets.
If the centre of the cyclone is passing directly over your house there will be a lull in the wind and rain lasting for half and hour or so.
During this time do not go out; because immediately after that very strong winds will blow from the opposite direction.
Switch off electrical mains in your house.Remain calm.

string-array.name: cycloned
string-array.item: Don’t run
Ignore rumours and do not spread them; this will help to avoid panic situations.
Do not delay and run the risk of being marooned

string-array.name: fire
string-array.item: Repair defecting wiring.
Get a fire extinguisher now.
Cover yourself with blanket when exposed to flame.
On being trapped stuff side gap of the door with cloth.
Keep a first aid kit ready.
Help wire victims.
To extinguish fire, use stand, dust, loose earth or fire extinguisher.
Call 101 for Fire Bridge.
In a smoke filled room, don’t walk, crawl.

string-array.name: fired
string-array.item: Do not delay and run the risk of being marooned
Don’t throw water on electrical appliance.
Don’t play with fire.

string-array.name: tsunami
string-array.item: Keep a disaster kit ready with important documents, torch, radio and medicines in approachable distance at your house.
After earthquake occurred, if you are in a coastal area, move to higher ground and listen to a Radio, TV, Tsunami Warning Sirens, or other reliable source for tsunami alert/warning issue or not.
If you hear an official tsunami warning or detect signs of a tsunami, evacuate at once coastal areas and tsunami vulnerable areas and vessels to move into Deep Ocean.
Take your Disaster Supplies Kit before evacuation.
A tsunami is a series of waves that may continue for hours. Do not assume that after one wave the danger is over.
The next wave may be larger than the first one.
Return home only after local officials tell you it is safe.

string-array.name: tsunamid
string-array.item: Nothing to Display

string-array.name: flood
string-array.item: Listen to radio or TV weather reports for warning and advice and be alert.
Identify safe shelter in your area. These should be cyclone resistant and also find the closest route to reach them.
.All your family members should know the safe routes to nearest shelter/raised pucca house.
Keep your emergency kit and basic food supply, medicines, torch and batteries etc. ready in waterproof bags. Drink preferably boiled water. Keep your food covered.
Doors, windows, roof and walls should be strengthened before the cyclone season through retrofitting and repairing. Store adequate food grains and water in safe places.
If your area in flood-prone, consider suitable flood resistant building materials.
Do not let children and pregnant woman remain empty stomach.
Raise furniture, clothing and valuable onto beds, tables and in attic in flood prone area.
Turn off the main electricity power supply. Do not use electrical appliance, which have been in flood water.
Remain indoors until advised that the cyclone has passed away.
In case of cyclone alert, do not go out, till officially advised that it is safe. If evacuated, wait till advised to go back. Use the recommended route to return to your home. Do not rush.
Be careful of broken powers lines, damaged roads and house, fallen trees etc.
Be careful of snakes, as snake bites are common during floods.

string-array.name: floodd
string-array.item: Do not get into water of unknown depth and current.
Do not allow children to play in, or near flood water.
Do not venture into the sea if so advised. Stay Indoors under the strongest part of the house, if not moved to the cyclone shelter.
